head.title: Into America: How Open a Door?

hedline.hl1: Into America: How Open a Door?

abstract.p: John Brock letter responds to July 23 editorial on immigration; contends immigration should be reduced in order to slow growth of divisive ethnic voting blocs

block.p: A July 23 editorial acknowledges that unskilled immigration hurts unskilled American workers but rejects the common-sense solution of reducing unskilled immigration as politically unfeasible because it would offend increasingly powerful Hispanic and Asian-American voters. Rather than increase immigration, as the editorial proposes, we need to slow the growth of divisive ethnic voting blocs by rolling immigration back to the moderate levels of the mid-1960's.
